elena_opens_up.speaker: Narrator
elena_opens_up.text: Elena lingers after the cafe empties out. She's been staring at her empty cup for nearly an hour, lost in thought.

player_check.speaker: You
player_check.text: Another cup? Or just some company?

elena_startled.speaker: Elena
elena_startled.text: *She looks up, surprised* I... company, I suppose. If you don't mind sitting with someone who isn't very good at talking about feelings.

player_sits.speaker: Narrator
player_sits.text: You sit across from her. Your dragon curls up nearby, its warm presence filling the silence until Elena is ready to speak.

elena_begins.speaker: Elena
elena_begins.text: You want to know what happened between us. Everyone always does. The curious cafe owner who watches the dramatic siblings...

choices.text: Only if you want to share. Your story is yours to keep or tell.
I've learned that telling stories can sometimes heal them.

elena_appreciates.speaker: Elena
elena_appreciates.text: *A sad smile* You're kind. Kinder than I probably deserve. I've been... bitter. For so long. It's become who I am.

elena_considers.speaker: Elena
elena_considers.text: *She considers this* Maybe. Maybe that's true. I've held this story so tightly it's grown thorns. Perhaps letting some of it out...

elena_tells_story.speaker: Elena
elena_tells_story.text: Thomas and I were close. Inseparable growing up. Our parents called us two halves of one whole. Then he met Margot.

elena_about_margot.speaker: Elena
elena_about_margot.text: She was charming. Beautiful. Everyone loved her. But I saw... something else. The way she isolated Thomas from his friends. The way she twisted his words against people.

elena_warned.speaker: Elena
elena_warned.text: I tried to warn him. *Her voice breaks slightly* I tried so hard. But he was in love. And Margot was clever. She made me look jealous. Paranoid. Over-protective.

elena_falling_out.speaker: Elena
elena_falling_out.text: The last thing Thomas said to me before I left... he said I was poison. That I couldn't stand to see anyone happy because I was so miserable inside. *Tears form but don't fall*

elena_aftermath.speaker: Elena
elena_aftermath.text: He chose her over his own family. Over me. And for five years, I convinced myself I didn't care. That he was dead to me. But hearing that she left him...

choices.text: You feel vindicated, but also sad for him.
Part of you still cares, even after everything.

elena_truth.speaker: Elena
elena_truth.text: *A bitter laugh* Vindicated. Yes. I was RIGHT. But being right... it doesn't feel like I thought it would. It just feels empty.

elena_admits.speaker: Elena
elena_admits.text: *Her facade cracks* Of course I still care. He's my brother. I HATE that I still care. But when he walked through that door... I felt twelve years old again.

elena_confides_end.speaker: Elena
elena_confides_end.text: *She wipes her eyes quickly* I don't know if I can forgive him. I don't know if I should. But I'm... tired of carrying this anger alone.

dragon_comfort.speaker: Narrator
dragon_comfort.text: Your dragon rests its head on Elena's lap. She strokes it absently, and for the first time, she looks less like a fortress and more like a person.
